metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12418 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.28, 8.5.0 to 8.5.47, 7.0.0 and 7.0.97 isconfigured with the JMX Remote Lifecycle Listener, a local attacker withoutaccess to the Tomcat process or configuration files is able to manipulatethe RMI registry to perform a man-in-the-middle attack to capture usernames and passwords used to access the JMX interface. The attacker can thenuse these credentials to access the JMX interface and gain complete controlover the Tomcat instance.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat8 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.11').
